newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian Stocks to Watch Today - July 11.
newsitem.headline: Australian Stocks to Watch Today - July 11.

text.p: Some Australian stocks to watch this morning:

Stockbroker J.B. Were Group Holdings Ltd said in a substantial shareholding notice to the Australian Stock Exchange it had cut its stake in magazine and multi-media group PMP Communications Ltd to 10.25 pecent from 40.5 percent.

Newcrest Mining Ltd rejected market rumours on Thursday that it faced a margin call from ANZ Securities on its February equity-gold swap arrangement over its 11.9 percent stake in Normandy Mining Ltd. Newcrest investor relations manager David Sasson told Reuters that Newcrest was well short of the trigger point which would force Newcrest to lodge a margin with ANZ.
Australian Pharmaceuticals Industries Ltd said on Friday that after seeing the results for the first two months of the year that it expected sales to reach A$1 billion in the year to April 30, 1998.

Appliance manufacturer and winemaker Southcorp Holdings Ltd said on Friday it had bought a 250 hectare property in California to develop its first offshore vineyard. Once completed, the total Californian development would represent an investment of about A$15 million, Southcorp said.

Woolworths Ltd reported a return to double-digit quarterly sales growth on Thursday, outperforming its expectations to post annual sales growth of 9.25 percent. Chief executive officer Reg Clairs said the result, built on a progressive improvement throughout the year, was gratifying and showed some slight return of consumer confidence.

Santos Ltd said on Thursday it recorded a gas flow of three million cubic feet per day from Beeree-1, a gas exploration well in permit ATP 259P in south west Queensland. Santos said it used air drilling technology which avoids damage to the formation and achieves a better gas flow rate to confirm a good gas flow from potentially low quality rock in Beeree-1.
